description: The Nikko fir (Abies homolepis) is truly amazing. Native to northern Japan and parts of Russia, it is a popular choice for Christmas tree plantations and is also valued for its timber. The needles are dark green on top with a silver underside, and the trunk is known for its distinctive bark color. It is a stiff conifer with a medium growth rate and impressive architectural structure, making it an ideal choice for ornamental uses or as windbreak plants. Its soft, sweet-smelling timber is highly valued in furniture making, and it is also a popular choice for bonsai. The Nikko fir is a beautiful addition to any garden or landscape and adds a touch of the exotic to your home.
